unittitle.value: City University of New York "Irving Howe & His World" Conference Recording

abstract.value: This collection consists of one audio cassette containing a recording of the "Irving Howe & His World" Conference hosted by the City University of New York (CUNY). The tape was recorded on April 15, 1994, and only features recordings of the morning sessions of the conference. The day-long symposium was organized by the CUNY Center for the Humanities as a tribute to Howe following his death and featured and featured speakers including Mitchell Cohen, Michael Walzer, Marshall Berman, John Hollander, Morris Dickstein, Richard Rorty, Allen Mandelbaum, and Celia Morris. The conference focused on topics that had been of special interest to Howe during his career, including politics, Yiddish and Jewish culture, and the modern literary imagination.

p.value: Identification of item, date; City University of New York "Irving Howe and His World" Conference Recording; TAM 728; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection in 2014.110.

Irving Howe (1920-1993) was a Jewish-American literary, social, and political critic. He was a professor of literature at the City University of New York, a founder of the Democratic Socialists of America, and a founding editor of the magazine <emph render="italic">Dissent</emph>. The "Irving Howe & His World" conference was organized by the City University of New York Center for the Humanities as a tribute to Howe following his death. The day-long symposium was held on April 15, 1995 and featured speakers including Mitchell Cohen, Michael Walzer, Marshall Berman, John Hollander, Morris Dickstein, Richard Rorty, Allen Mandelbaum, and Celia Morris. The conference focused on topics that had been of special interest to Howe during his career, including politics, Yiddish and Jewish culture, and the modern literary imagination.

This collection consists of one audio cassette containing a recording of the "Irving Howe & His World" Conference hosted by the City University of New York. The tape was recorded on April 15, 1994, and only features recordings of the morning sessions of the conference.
